summary: This document is a chain of emails from January 2020 among U.S. Attorney's Office (SDNY) staff coordinating travel and hotel bookings for an interview in Stockholm, Sweden, related to the Epstein investigation (2018R01618). The emails reference prior travel for the same case to locations including Los Angeles and West Palm Beach for victim interviews.

events.title: Planned Interview in Stockholm
events.description: The SDNY team requests travel approval for an interview near Stockholm, Sweden, planned for January 29th and/or 30th, 2020.

events.title: Interview in Los Angeles
events.description: Prior travel request for an interview (or interviews) in Los Angeles on December 16 and/or 17, 2019.

events.title: Interview in Los Angeles
events.description: Prior travel request for an interview in Los Angeles on November 14, 2019.

events.title: Interview in West Palm Beach
events.description: Prior travel request for an interview in West Palm Beach on November 4, 2019, involving two team members.

events.title: Victim Interview in Los Angeles
events.description: Travel request for a victim interview in Los Angeles, tentatively from Wednesday to Friday in June 2019.

events.title: Meetings and Interviews in West Palm Beach
events.description: Travel request for approximately three days for meetings and interviews in West Palm Beach, Florida, in late May 2019.

events.title: Meetings and Interviews in West Palm Beach
events.description: Travel request for approximately three days for meetings and interviews in West Palm Beach, Florida, in early April 2019, for the case United States v. Epstein.

events.title: Meetings and Interviews in Florida
events.description: Initial travel request for two days of meetings and interviews in West Palm Beach and/or Fort Lauderdale, Florida, in March 2019, for the case United States v. Epstein.

locations: Southern District of New York (SDNY) U.S. Attorney's Office
keyFacts: The document shows active SDNY investigation travel related to the Epstein case (2018R01618) as late as January 2020, planning an international interview in Stockholm.
Multiple prior domestic trips for victim interviews in Los Angeles and West Palm Beach are referenced, indicating an ongoing investigative effort throughout 2019.
The case is formally referenced as 'United States v. Epstein, 2018R01618, an investigation relating to enticement of minors for sexual activity.'
Email correspondents' names and some recipient names are redacted, indicated by angle brackets (e.g., < >) in the text.
Travel logistics include detailed flight itineraries (with layovers in Paris and London) and hotel selection discussions, showing formal government travel procedures.
